question_text: What should you consider regarding motherboard warranty during troubleshooting and repairs?
answer_options: Warranty considerations are irrelevant during troubleshooting procedures
Check warranty status before disassembly, document problems, follow RMA procedures if covered
All motherboards have lifetime warranties that cover any type of damage
Warranty only covers software issues and never hardware problems
correct_answer: Check warranty status before disassembly, document problems, follow RMA procedures if covered
explanation: Motherboard warranty considerations: 1) Check warranty status and terms before opening case, 2) Document problems and symptoms, 3) Take photos of damage if visible, 4) Follow manufacturer's RMA procedures, 5) Avoid actions that void warranty (removing warranty stickers, physical damage from troubleshooting), 6) Keep purchase receipts and original packaging.
